jade, 18yo, she/her

currently sad bc of season 8

summary:
I think Daenerys should’ve never gone directly to Kings Landing to take the throne. 
She should’ve visited every kingdom....
body:
I think Daenerys should’ve never gone directly to Kings Landing to take the throne.

She should’ve visited every kingdom. Introduce herself to the people. Build a reputation. Let them know about how she freed cities in Essos. How she helped Jon Snow defeat the army of the dead. Amaze them with dragons. Bond with them, Margeory style. Make them love her. Make allies. Get the whole fucking continent to root for her. Just like she did in Essos. It would’ve taken time but it would’ve been efficient. The people would’ve loved her (the woman she was before season 8). They would’ve wanted her to be queen. Only then she would’ve destroyed Cercei’s army and take the throne and she’d have the whole fucking country at her feet.

Gaining people’s trust and support is the best way to succeed in politics.

Attacking Kings Landing, even without the whole mad queen slaughter, was never going to work. You can’t be queen of a people who doesn’t even know who you really are.

summary: Although I will admit even though I get the newer episodes, they were straight up messy. They missed so much in editing it’s...
body:
Although I will admit even though I get the newer episodes, they were straight up messy. They missed so much in editing it’s sad. Also, at least have Dany give a reason for doing it although I get her reasoning, and at least tell me why Arya didn’t go kill Cersei after that was her main goal? Like? What?????? Also where is Yara? Where’d she go? And wtf is up with Greyworm? Like bro bro? I know you didn’t want to kill those people bro bro.

Maybe greyworm killed the people because Missandei got her head chopped off idk.

blog.name: hopelesstvaddict
blog.title: worry about the past. the future can wait.
blog.description:
No need to know the nAme. 
Swoon and marvel at simple things.
LOST defined life. Live in the Enchanted Forest. Love what happens in Westeros. Wish you could hang out in Rosewood with some pretty little liars. Agonize over the events in Beacon Hills. And so on. Unconditional Cut & Run, Titanic and LOTR lover. 
Proud Princess Aurora, Sansa Stark and Alison Dilaurentis supporter.

body:
GOT 8x05 Quick disorganized thoughts

  • Overall I liked the episode. There. We’ve made that clear
  • No time jumping. No fast travel. Always a good point
  • Dark Dany. Yes. Yes. Yes. And no it wasn’t OOC or too sudden. It’s been there for seasons now.
  • All the action is concentrated in the South. Meaning no Winterfell and I kept wondering when were we gonna switch to the North. But smart choice
  • Miguel Sapochnik’s direction is really the best. But I still place this one behind The Long Night and I maintain that Battle of the Bastards is still the best GOT episode. Ever
  • All episode long I kept thinking ‘man Sansa would SO not approve any of this shit’
  • 'Sandor’. That’s it
  • Seriously I also disagree that Arya’s character development was thrown away. That was always the point. To let her grow from all this rage and sense of vengeance that’s been eating her alive since forever and let her become human again. Have her gain back a sense of humanity. That was what Maisie said her arc would be, finding that balance between Arya the girl she was and Arya the killing machine she has become
  • Cleganebowl. Of course they’d save it until the end. And no I didn’t find it anticlimactic. As much as I wanted Sandor to win, his brother is a fucking zombie. He cannot be killed like that. Sandor had an amazing character arc and his redemption climaxed here through his relationship with Arya. The last thing he needed to resolve was his brother and ultimately they were too linked to each other to survive. Neither could win properly and Sandor was not a good man either. A happy ending was never in the cards for him
  • The same applies for Jaime and Cersei. Call me crazy but I actually liked their ending. A bit melodramatic maybe ? But the whole episode portrays Cersei in a rather sympathetic way, far from the ruthless persona we’ve seen before. This is partly to really portray Dany as the villain here. And the reasoning works here too. Jaime might be a redeemed man but he is not a good man. Neither is Cersei. There was no happy ending for them either
  • Though I thought that Jaime would kill Cersei I’m glad that this is not what happened. Jaime and Cersei started the series and their lives together. It makes sense they would end it in a similar way. We knew that Cersei would die this episode. We didn’t expect Jaime to be there with her nor the manner of death. But believe me or not I’m actually satisfied. Having Dany kill Cersei would probably have been too much
  • Jaime recognizes that his relationship with Cersei is toxic and yet they’re irredeemably intertwined and I was sold. By Lena and Nikolaj’s acting solely
  • Dany finally alienates herself from Jon. Jon finally understands what his Queen is. Better late than never
  • Varys is betrayed by Tyrion. I didn’t understand why… is Tyrion really this loyal to Dany ? Did he purposely blind himself until he couldn’t anymore ? Jon is creeped out by the burning alive. He just couldn’t do anything about it because he’s afraid of Dany. The difference with Mance in S5 is he did something then because he wasn’t afraid to stand up to Stannis
  • Lol how could so many Dothraki survive the charge against the wights ?
  • Greyworm loses it and he’s seemingly gonna go up against Jon. But I understood where he came from. Missandei’s passing was handled properly, both from Greyworm and Dany’s side
  • Jon will have to rise up against Dany. He has no choice. Here for it but I really hope they don’t pull the tragic love story card. Please confirm that Jon was not a stupid lovesick fool
  • Where will Arya go ? To find Jon ? Back North ?
  • Seriously it’s been two major battles and we were robbed of Jon and Arya fighting alongside each other. I’d have loved to see Jon being smacked at how good his baby sister has become
  • Jon saving the girl from rape indeed reminded me of Sansa’s near rape scene. In fact that’s not the only time I was reminded of Sansa. When Arya passes civilians there are many shots of girls in lady dresses and frightened non-fighters who reminded me of Sansa - who stands for this specific group of people. Maybe that was just me
  • Euron. Glad the fucker is done with. Kind of weirded out that Dany is able to take on his entire fleet and the whole of the ballistas this time around yet she was so ineffective in the last episode but ok. I was so happy Jaime killed him though I also wish Dany burned him
  • No Sansa vs Cersei showdown I guess. A tad disappointed
  • What happened with the scene where Jon kneels to Cersei ? So that wasn’t a scene at all ?
  • Remembering that Sophie was incredibly satisfied with her ending. That she kept a spoilery scroll as a souvenir and that she was gifted the storyboard for her final scene. Excited to see what this is. Apparently Sophie filmed in Spain but perhaps she won’t go south at all ?
  • Dany will want to deal with her though. And with Jon. She will come for the Starks. She wants to instigate fear but she knows Sansa is not afraid. Jon is or was up until this episode
  • The promo for the series finale focuses on Arya, Tyrion and Dany. Sansa isn’t shown meaning they don’t want to reveal anything on her scenes yet. And what they don’t show us is usually the meaty part of the episodes
  • That’s it. More complete recap to come later
  • Oh and Ramin Djawadi really took a vacation between Ep3 and Ep5 because he’s back at doing actual great music again

When Arya passes civilians there are many shots of girls in lady dresses and frightened non-fighters who reminded me of Sansa - who stands for this specific group of people. Maybe that was just me
  • Euron. Glad the fucker is done with. Kind of weirded out that Dany is able to take on his entire fleet and the whole of the ballistas this time around yet she was so ineffective in the last episode but ok. I was so happy Jaime killed him though I also wish Dany burned him
  • No Sansa vs Cersei showdown I guess. A tad disappointed
  • What happened with the scene where Jon kneels to Cersei ? So that wasn’t a scene at all ?
  • Remembering that Sophie was incredibly satisfied with her ending. That she kept a spoilery scroll as a souvenir and that she was gifted the storyboard for her final scene. Excited to see what this is. Apparently Sophie filmed in Spain but perhaps she won’t go south at all ?
  • Dany will want to deal with her though. And with Jon. She will come for the Starks. She wants to instigate fear but she knows Sansa is not afraid. Jon is or was up until this episode
  • The promo for the series finale focuses on Arya, Tyrion and Dany. Sansa isn’t shown meaning they don’t want to reveal anything on her scenes yet. And what they don’t show us is usually the meaty part of the episodes
  • That’s it. More complete recap to come later
  • Oh and Ramin Djawadi really took a vacation between Ep3 and Ep5 because he’s back at doing actual great music again

  • Seriously it’s been two major battles and we were robbed of Jon and Arya fighting alongside each other. I’d have loved to see Jon being smacked at how good his baby sister has become
  • Jon saving the girl from rape indeed reminded me of Sansa’s near rape scene. In fact that’s not the only time I was reminded of Sansa. When Arya passes civilians there are many shots of girls in lady dresses and frightened non-fighters who reminded me of Sansa - who stands for this specific group of people. Maybe that was just me
  • Euron. Glad the fucker is done with. Kind of weirded out that Dany is able to take on his entire fleet and the whole of the ballistas this time around yet she was so ineffective in the last episode but ok. I was so happy Jaime killed him though I also wish Dany burned him
  • No Sansa vs Cersei showdown I guess. A tad disappointed
  • What happened with the scene where Jon kneels to Cersei ? So that wasn’t a scene at all ?
  • Remembering that Sophie was incredibly satisfied with her ending. That she kept a spoilery scroll as a souvenir and that she was gifted the storyboard for her final scene. Excited to see what this is. Apparently Sophie filmed in Spain but perhaps she won’t go south at all ?
  • Dany will want to deal with her though. And with Jon. She will come for the Starks. She wants to instigate fear but she knows Sansa is not afraid. Jon is or was up until this episode
  • The promo for the series finale focuses on Arya, Tyrion and Dany. Sansa isn’t shown meaning they don’t want to reveal anything on her scenes yet. And what they don’t show us is usually the meaty part of the episodes
  • That’s it. More complete recap to come later
  • Oh and Ramin Djawadi really took a vacation between Ep3 and Ep5 because he’s back at doing actual great music again

blog.name: theyruinedeuron
blog.title: PURE RANDOMNESS
blog.description: Euron Stan, Jonerys warrior, fitblr participiant. Back for s8. Will blog about w/e I feel like. Mostly just a place to post self-indulgent gym selfies. Half the jonerys fandom hates me because why the hell not?

title: Another issue
body:
Is because of the way they’ve done the madness, out of grief and loneliness (as opposed to Tyrion egging her on or as opposed to a god complex) and the lack of substance to the CoTF/Whitewalker story line, essentially, the Night King and the AoTD were JUST A PLOT DEVICE to further her descent into madness. It feels like it served NO. OTHER. PURPOSE.


Again, because Bran’s story line was cut off at the balls. 


Just bad. All bad.

summary: The only bittersweet thing about this shit show is that after years of ship wars, conflicting theories, views about every single...

summary: Questions about Dany: 1) you have said you believe that Dany is going to accidentally destroy King's Landing via dragon + wild...
question: Questions about Dany: 1) you have said you believe that Dany is going to accidentally destroy King's Landing via dragon + wild fire she doesn't know about. Is this her succumbing to Targ Madness? After the last episode lots of fans are now certain that she's going to go insane, but I'm not so sure. I'd love to hear your thoughts about a possible "Mad Queen Dany" scenario. 2) how will the destruction of KL impact her character going forward?
answer:
Do you think Dany will go mad before the end of the series?

Getting a lot of these questions lately. I’ve answered it before but apparently the show did something or other. Lumping most of them into a single answer.

If by mad, you mean incapable of accurately perceiving the world and reacting according to her observations following a logical progression of thought, no, I don’t think Daenerys is in any danger of that.

If by mad we mean that terrible destruction will be wrought by her actions and in-universe actors will sincerely believe that she’s engaged in wholesale cruelty (and not simply saying that to pursue a political purpose such as advancing their own candidate), yes, I think that will happen.

I’ve never been shy about how I believe that Daenerys’s attack on King’s Landing will set off Aerys’s wildfire caches, the last legacies of the Mad King and the game of thrones takes the entire half-million of the capital as its next bloody toll. This will put Daenerys into her lowest possible point, crushed psychologically. She will at last, sincerely believe that “she has the taint,” the question has been dogging her POV chapters.

At that point, I believe she’ll discover the Others, the Azor Ahai Reborn stuff, and go north to become a Hero and abandon the notion of becoming a queen.

Thanks for the question, Anon.

SomethingLikeALawyer, Hand of the King

body:
To the people that say we’re bitching about nothing and the antis that still ‘like’ the show:

Professional critics saying that Daenerys actions were totally out of the blue and OoC. They’re simply not buying it. It was trash.

So, antis: shut the fuck up.

summary: I’m genuinely confused why people are mad about Dany’s ending. She said once that she would take back what is rightfully hers...
body:
I’m genuinely confused why people are mad about Dany’s ending. She said once that she would take back what is rightfully hers with fire and blood. She said it. She said she was gonna do it. She told y’all face to face. Straight up. No cap. But y’all are shook now? Lolololol.SHE LOST TWO OF HER DRAGONS WHO WERE LIKE CHILDREN TO HER, SHE LOST TWO OF HER BEST FRIENDS, SHE WAS BETRAYED BY SEVERAL PEOPLE, NOBODY LIKES HER IN WESTEROS. AND YALL ARE SHOCKED SHE BURNED DOWN THE CITY? BITCH I WOULD TOO THE FUCK. Burn that bitch to the ground. You should’ve known it was coming.

People are making this into a gender thing and I think that’s fucked up. No. It’s not. Game of Thrones has had plenty of fucking crazy characters. Crazy ass characters that have been men. GOT doesn’t care about the gender. They care about shock factor. Each season something worse has to happen otherwise it would be boring. I mean come on. To put Dany OR Jon on the throne would be kind of boring. Because it’s expected. And people are shocked that Cersei cried? Yo? Cersei has always done everything for her children. When she was forced to walk naked through a city and was beaten she wasn’t pregnant. She didn’t have a baby. But now she has a child again. So she’s going to do everything she could to make sure that child survived. Because even though she was a crazy motherfucker, she loved her children more than anything.

blog.name: almostmentallyunstable
blog.title: group therapy for obsessive fandoms
blog.description: My name is Maria. I'm from Greece. This is my first blog!!! I've had it for a while and I was just spying on you guys like any normal stalker. I'm an obsessive shipper. So feel free to message me and we can freak out together. I like stydia, deckerstar, captain swan, olicity and shows like the big bang theory, ouat, grey's anatomy, teen wolf, lucifer e.t.c and stuff that I think are funny If you guys like any of these please follow me

body:
The Writing is Shit

My point isn’t that Dany’s Arc is rushed and they didn’t do it correctly… I can accept that she was supposed to go mad from what you book lovers tell me … But some of you tell me that it was done correctly and it was foreshadowed… What about the other characters because that’s my fucking point.

  1. Jamie Lannister: They fucked up his whole character arc so much… And it’s not just the fact that he went back to Cersei… It’s what his character said like I never cared much for them like he killed Aerys to protect those peopla and 2 episodes ago he was in the north fighting wights for those same people
  2. Tyrion Lannister is no longer smart… Like what the fuck?? And why is he trying to save Cersei… Last I checked he doesn’t even like her
  3. Cersei Lannister The greatest most developed villain of Got and dies from the fucking ceiling and dies in fear… Not to mention the fact that she did next to nothing this season… Doesn’t have a backup plan in case the city falls… And completely relies on Euron why!
  4. Jon Snow Since when does Jon follows someone blindly? And i know some people are like he is blinded by love?? That’s not Jon… Jon puts duty above love… Remember when he left Ygritte!! Now he doesn’t even speak up to disagree with Dany… Like obviously Sansa was right and they should have waited for the soldiers to rest. He knows that!!! And instead of saying sth he agrees with her… And if the rest of the leaks are true what was even the point of him being a Targaryen??

So I get it some of you are with your faves character arc… Some of you saw Danny being mad from a mile away… Well i didn’t I’m stupid… But Dany isn’t the only person getting a rushed ending is everyone… So don’t say the writing is good… The writing is shit and If you don’t see it now you might see it next ep!!!!

body:
The moral of GOT:

Nobody grows. Nobody becomes a better person. No one learns from the lessons of their past. They just suddenly and rapidly regress at the drop of a hat, and anyone who thinks it should be otherwise is an idealistic fool.
